content.detailedDescription: Once i spotted the object i immediately recognized it as the same look as the one photographed in gulf breeze. immediately i went outside in the darkness and with the binoculars could easily make out the disk and its apperance. the strobe on top of the machine lit up the entire object as it turned around and around. there were compartments or the appearance of as the structure looked worklike and functional. i watched for about 5 minutes when a b-52 flew directly for the object and directly above my head. it scared me to death as the disk was to my east and south and the b52 came from the north and west. it flew directly at the object and the object just moved upward at unbelievable speed. the disc stayed at that altitude for about an hour. i called my son and my wife also saw the craft but after the b-52 incident. the craft stayed in the air  until sunlight and i showed it to my son. at sunlight the craft was still there but we couldn't see it any longer in the sunlight. i am thinking the b-52 must have come from one of the sac bases to the west. the disc was emitting a brilliant white light from its bottom and possessed unbelievable maneauverability. it was just toying with the  b-52 and the jet made just one pass and was gone. obviously the air force was tracking it. the disc stayed visible for over an hour. i have no sketches of the disc but will make a detailed drawing if it is desired.
content.summary: Saw a brilliant white light approaching from the east. was writting an e mail befor work and thought it strange that i hadn't seen this light befor., grabbed  my binoculars and it was a disc shaped object. like the one photographed in gulf breeze some yrs

content.detailedDescription:
Ok, this will be quite an elaborate description, but i don't want to leave out anything that might raise doubts or eyebrows. this experience is imprinted into my memory, much as it would happen during any other historically-important moments in time - as a consequence there's a lot to tell.

just after half past nine in the evening of october 6th, i was walking my dogs as usual. the sky had been exceptionally clear compared to previous weeks, allowing me to spot a satellite passing overhead at relatively great speeds with the naked eye just prior to the actual incident.

about two minutes later, with me walking across a narrow, non-illuminated trail leading up to some exercise fields as well as dense forests + additional trails, i stood in awe when witnessing a bunch of tiny, bright objects gently moving along the tree line right in front of me (well, a bit to the left, that is). from my recollection, these little circles were red in color, although i cant tell from the pictures ive taken (in which they turn up blue/whiteish). a slight pulsating of light seemed to be occurring, although not as distinct and wide apart as youd expect from, say, civilian aircraft.

the most amazing thing was the fact that the individual objects seemed to be part of some sort of formation - they were moving as a whole, although every now and then, one of the objects would speed up and 'fall out of line' (towards either direction), so to speak.

all in all, i was able to count at least 4 objects within said formation - its likely that there were 7 or more. i have to add to this that the tree line (used as a point of reference) was no more than a 100 yards from my person, with the actual objects seemingly much further away (at least a few miles, i reckon) - so perhaps ive missed out on a few additional ones. either way, having seen the formerly-mentioned satellite pass by just yet and being all-too familiar with the brute power of overflying f16s and a10s (my house is pretty much located underneath a military flight path), i was pretty clueless as to what was happening before my own eyes.

seeing as how i live in a forested area with lots of natural beauty present there, i never leave the house without my digicam - the evening of october 6th was no exception to the rule. however, with darkness gradually kicking in earlier every day (compared to reasonably-clear summer evenings), and my photo-taking skills limited to simple broad-daylight/macro shots kind of stuff, i had no idea what to do with my camera other than to switch between various modes and just 'snap away'. at first i felt very nervous about missing out on the experience altogether, seeing as how long it took to switch between the various camera modes with nothing other than the on screen display to assist me. however, much to my surprise, the event would go on to last another 3 minutes or so.

whilst shooting pictures (15 or so in total, half of which ive deleted instantly), i tried to somehow get a decent light source near the vicinity of the objects - again, i had virtually no point of reference other than the tree line and lamp posts. my digicams built-in lcd wasnt helping at all, leaving me to act on gut feeling rather than anything else (not a good thing, that is). pointing at the thingies in the sky with a flashlight didnt turn out to be genuinely useful either. in order to improve the situation a bit, i proceeded to walk closer so as to look past the actual tree line (then partially blocking my view).

in the process of doing so, i felt a bit distracted by a small gathering of partygoers to the right of me (another 200 yards away from me), forcing me to focus attention on my dogs and getting them their leashes on. after noticing said people, it just struck me how quiet everything had been beforehand. just the motorway's humming of passing vehicles, 400 yards or so in the distance - no roaring of jet engines as can be experienced when the f16s and a10s are up to their business as usual (every two weeks or so, can be heard from miles away, especially in such clear conditions).

besides the tranquillity, another fact that conflicts with the 'military craft' (or civilian airliners for that matter) option is the fact that these objects seemed to be hovering 10 miles or so away, which would put them very near (if not across) the belgian-dutch border - not a typical place for 4 or more belgian (or dutch for that matter) fighter jets to pull off all kinds of weird stunts. plus, military jets tend to not randomly disappear en masse either, unless i've missed out on lockheed���s latest production cycle.

in all fairness, the actual airbase is located pretty close to said border, but its fighters never venture northbound (towards the border) - rather, they will usually end up going south (inland) and then east (towards my place) before returning to base.

it wasnt until having walked up to the well-lit cross section of this areas various trails, that i lost track of the formation of objects entirely. i've tried to look out for it in the following 10 minutes or so, but to no avail. all the while i was still very much in a state of curiousity-meets-nervosity, trying to make sense of what had just happened. i was assuring myself that others (within a radius of at least a few miles) surely must have witnessed the same phenomenon, as it occurred on a saturday night, during (or just prior to) 'going out' time. all the way back, i couldn't help but looking over my shoulder, yet nothing popped up anymore other than noisy civilian aircraft.

after returning home, it turned out that most of the pictures contained nothing more than utter darkness and a few faint lights (from the lamp posts bordering the forest zone). luckily enough, after a few iterations of enhancing two particular pictures i was able to at least extract some evidence of the formation having been there in the first place. naturally, i've kept the original pictures to provide as evidence should anyone really care. the "evidence" i'm providing through these pictures is a little rough around the edges, to say the least - i personally have always hated vague material like this, but given the circumstances i'm hoping for you to bear with me.

in between, i managed to shoot two movies as well - unfortunately, these show the typical 'jerky movement' kind of pictures of a few lights doing nothing in particular. again, i've enhanced this material a bit yet the results are quite appalling still. if anyone's interested i could still provide the enhanced and/or the original video footage, though.

to conclude all of this, i will add that i've always taken a liking to looking at the skies above, yet remain extremely skeptic of anything related to extraterrestials and whatnot. i've seen my fair share of weird stuff up there, yet was mostly able to track down the meaning of it all afterwards. in this particular case, however, i stand empty-handed and have to ask for possible additional witnesses to come forward.

maybe these are thai floating lampoons (quite a fad as of late)? perhaps, but they're illegal here due to forest fire hazards - plus it wouldn't account for the rather sudden position changes at times. feel free to fill me in if you can.
content.summary: Formation of several bright, slow-moving objects relatively gently rolling westwards before disappearing altogether

content.detailedDescription:
My spouse, friend david & i were sitting on my patio conversing between approximately 10:00 pm and 12:00 midnight on or about june 22, 2007. the vantage point from my patio is approximately 100 degrees over the high desert from an altitude of 5,100 ft above sea level. my view is from approximately 10 to 15 degrees from west of north to directly south (north west to south). at approximately 11:00 pm, david, who was seated at the patio table facing north) commented on a dark object with a series horizontal of lights that were parallel to the ground. the object was about 10 degrees west of north and appeared just over the roofline of my neightbor's home next door (toward the north. the lights appeared to be evenly spaced and parallel to the roofline. after approximately 10 seconds, the lights disappeared. about 3 to 5 minutes later, i saw the same lights, only directly north and just east of my neighbor's house where there was no obstructed view of the object desert floor below. when i initially saw the object, the lights (pure white, almost bright) were stationery and did not move. after about 15 seconds of viewing, the lights either went off one-by-one in a syncronized fashion (from left to right) or they began to slowly rotate in a counter-clockwise direction at a slow speed. i say this beacuse i could never clearly see the shape or perimeter of the object. the moon was in a new phse and there was little ambient light in the vicinity. the lights appeared to either go off, then on or rotate in a counter-clockwise direction for approximately 30 to 45 seconds. the it appeared as though the direction of the lights' rotation (or sequence of being activated/deactived) reversed to a clockwise direction. this continued for about another minute to one & one half minutes and the lights totally extinguished, never to be seen again. although i failed to count the lights, i am estimating there were 15 to 20 in all. while i witnessed, along with my wife and david. the object moved very slowly toward the east over el mirage dry lake bed. not able to see the object's perimeter or shape with any certaintly, it was almost impossible to guage its distance away from me, as well as its lateral movement. for the sake of an estimate, i'm guessing that the lights were about 800 to 1000 feet off of the desert floor and its overall easterly movement approximately 3 to 5 miles. for clarification, the lights appeared to be components of a single craft due to the fact that they were evenly dispersed laterally and the same altitude from ground level, moving the then same direction & speed at all times. when looking around the lights (attempting to determine the object's perimeter/shape/size), there was no visable detail from the hills or terrain behind the object nor any stars behind/above it were visable at all, it was pure black. i have never witnessed anything like this before, nor had my friend david or my wife. we are 100% certain that we did witness a ufo. the question is whether it was controlled by extra-terestrials or the local government (right next door to edwards afb). purley amazing.

ps: my camera batteries were dead or i would have grabbed it and taken photos!
content.summary: Very large dark object hovering over the dry lake bed near el mirage ca
content.locationName: El Mirage dry lake bed, California

content.detailedDescription:
on my way to sacramento for an assignment, i stopped to see my mother and sisters in el paso. after a short stay, i left sunday morning early on i-10 west. while joining i-25 north near canutillo, texas i noticed a white rectangular sharp edged craft on the driver's side of my truck(northwest). i did not see a tether or any kind of an attachment.It was approximately less than a mile up in elevation.   
it was completely stationary as if it was hovering. i watched it as i was driving to las cruces to pick up i-10 west again. when i looked back after joining i-10 it was gone. i didn't think much about it since ft.Bliss and white sands missle range are always experimenting with drones and missles. seeing the craft was quite easy, the early morning sun reflected brilliant white on such a clear day.
content.summary: White,no markings,rectangular,equal sides,flat bottom,couldn't see the top

content.detailedDescription:
We left from the laconia airport, laconia, new hampshire at about 8:30 am on wednesday morning october 3, 2007. our plane was a small single engine plane. i have not disclosed these findings of ufo's to the pilot as i would prefer you examine the original shots and the photos i enhanced via contrast and color saturation...Before i talk to him. only the two of us were in the plane and we observed no unusual sitings during the plane ride.

the objects only appeared to me as i looked through the shots on my computer and i noticed the light dots in the distance. because i shot these pictures through the windows of the plane i tried to determine if the dots were reflections from inside the plane.. 

we encountered the heaviest of cloud cover over and between saco and lewiston, maine...Having reached saco about 20 minutes into our flight. the radio transmission reported cloud cover at about 400 feet. 

since i took over 150 photos that morning using a 6.5 megapixel nikon d40 slr, i will only email a few shots. if you would like a disc of all the shots for your perusal only i will send one to you upon your request. i would like to remain anonymous.
content.summary: Flying between saco and lewiston maine with heavy cloud cover. wanted to take aerials of foliage but too many clouds.  so i just shot pretty and interesting cloud shots.  saw nothing remarkable till all shots were unloaded into my computer.

content.detailedDescription: On sunday  september 30th,at about 6:30 pm, about 20 miles south of laramie wyoming while driving north on highway 287, my wife spotted what, at first, looked  like a white cloud or contrail in the west high above the snowy range mountains. i was driving and listening to the radio. it was a cloudless sky, so the white streak stood out.  after watching about five minutes she alerted me that it was a craft.  she saw revolving lights under the object.  the lights also changed color to blue and then red, then back to white. i looked and saw it  and pulled off the road to get a good look.  the object was not moving.  we had the mountain range to use as a marker.As we continued to drive toward laramie we could see the object did not move.  it was about two inches wide at arms length and we estimate it to be 30-40 miles west of us.It was about a fist above the mountains.  we continued to watch until we reached laramie about twenty to twenty-five minutes after we first spoted it.  there was no mistaking it with anything we know.  we are both experienced sky-watchers and this was the real deal.
content.summary: Looked like contrail in western sky, but did not move for 25 minutes. had rotating lights on underside

content.detailedDescription: Totally awesome sighting, if i may say so.  this happens to be my second sighting this year, and it definately takes the cake.  okay, we were heading to the denver zoo (one of the best i've visited) and were abruptly distracted by this large, wormlike formation floating through the sky.  we later came to the conclusion that it was some huge ballon released during the broncos game - i hate skepticism!  either way, one thing that definately stood out were these "orb"-like formations that were zipping all around the "balloon"/worm-like thingy.  in our attempts to write these things off as more balloons we ended up with the notion that they were something else.  they were moving incredibly fast around the "worm" and eventually we noticed, like, 8-12 of these things way up in the atmospere.  orb-like in structure, incredibly bright, color changing and visible through the cloud layer that they had passed behind.  we watched them for 15 minutes or so as they quickly rotated around and around - there was no way (in our minds) that these could have been balloons, they were just moving way too fast for that altitude.  yeah. . . .
content.summary: Fleet accompanied by large worm-like manifestation!!!

content.detailedDescription: I was standing in my front yard when i looked up and saw five objecting miving from norteast to south west.  they appeared to be at an altitudte that would mean they were outside our atmosphere and they appeared to be reflecting sunlight.  the event took place ove a period of four to five minutes.
content.summary: Five vehicless traveling northeast to southwest.

content.detailedDescription: We took this digital photo on 9/28 but could not see the ship on the screen, only on the camera view. doctored it by brightening and cropped it to show what we have been seeing daily,
content.summary: Photo of "mother" for nh sightings

content.detailedDescription: See previous report, thank you.
content.summary: Bright light no noise suddenly disapeared, the date is october 7th...Not the 27th

content.detailedDescription: I was looking at the sky like usual smoking a cigarette outside then i saw a very bright light like a big star moving south to north, the speed was that of a plane the altitude quite low. there was no noise at all neither any flashing lights as on a plane. it flew over my house then the light became smaller and smaller to finally a tiny little red point and suddenly disapeared. there was no clouds in the sky, the night was really clear and it was very easy to see the stars. everything lasted about 1 mn.
content.summary: Bright light no noise suddenly disapeared

content.detailedDescription: My friend and i were on a swing in his backyard, when he pointed out a cigar shaped object speeding from south to north in the johnson's ferry/ shallowford area. it was just below the cumulus clouds and even then looked fairly small. probably between 40 to 60 feet long. the craft was white/slightly metallic.  if you have any questions please email me @ psearchery@hotmail.Com
content.summary: Ufo flew at a low speed for approximately 2 minutes, then disappeared.

content.detailedDescription: A good friend of mine took this photo, and i scanned it. he took it from the inside of his truck on the way to a friends house. he watch it for about 10 min and left. he said it made no noise and made no movements.
content.summary: Ufo in springfield, mo  (fellows lake ) after the ice storm

content.detailedDescription:
With a newfound interest in the subject of ufos and being 14 years of age at the time; i had resigned myself to spending 2 weeks "watching the skies" from my bedroom window! it was a time where i was paying much greater attention to the sky and is really the only reason i noticed what i did.

the sky was clear and blue. what i saw first appeared to be a commercial airliner- just as high in altitude, a similar chem-trail, appearing speed, linear movement...Nothing out of the ordinary. what drew my attention to it in the first place was the reflection of the sun's light from it's metallic surface. on closer inspection however, the profile of the solid metallic object was not as distinguishable as you would expect it to be if it were a commercial airliner. i also noticed that the white "chem-trail" was not lingering for very long either. something just wasn't quite right and it held my attention.

i must have watched it cross the sky in an earthly fashion for around 5-10 seconds...(from left to right) however this "commercial-airliner" suddenly stopped dead in mid-air. the object then moved much faster than before back in the direction it had came without "turning" or rotating(right to left)  

this seemingly irrational change in linear direction was immediately marked by the emission of a very thick, black smoke-trail which came from the "front" or "other" end of the craft. watching from a window it quickly disappeared from my available view.
 
despite having been desperate to see a ufo with my own eyes at the time, it was ironic that what i saw terrified me so much that i ended up in tears!  as irrational as it seems now, especially given the altitude of the object, one of the thoughts or feelings i had at the time was "if i can see it what's stopping it from seeing me?."
content.summary: High-altitude metallic ufo with trails at both ends of craft

content.detailedDescription:
Me, my mom and grandmother were driving to grocery store.  we saw a cigar craft hovering either over a tree or next to a tree about 40 maybe less feet off the ground, right next to the road and near a house.  rural road.
mom pulled over. she and myself got out of the car to look.  the craft had no windows, seams, and it was dark gunmetal matte grey in appearance.  it was the size of a yellow school bus.  i tried to walk under the ufo, but my mom said, "no" and my grandmother was shreiking.  there was no sound comimng from craft.  we watched it for approx 15 minutes, drove off when another car pulled up as we were driving off.  we went grocery shopping and came back to look for the craft, but it was gone.  i have reported this before, but no one takes it seriously.  no one talked about this, mother believes that maybe we were somehow hynotized not to make any big deal out of it.  i was not afraid, but grandmother was crying and saying for us to get back in the car because if the craft took us she "could not drive a shift stick"....Unbelievable, but true.
content.summary: Cigar craft hovering near house, close to ground...October, 1973

content.detailedDescription: My husband and i (and other witnesses) have seen nightly sightings in nh in the western sky. we are visiting my daughter in denver and decided to look and see if we could see anything here. we went out to their deck to look. well, we, my daughter, her boyfriend, and their roommate all saw, with us, a very similar sighting. a large star-like mother ship and smaller lights that move around it. the mother rose from 15 degrees on the horizon to 60 degrees over 3 hours iwth a scout in tow. they rose to the northeast. it made rapid movements to the west and east and went up and stayed stationary several times.
content.flightPath: Stationary,Straight-line path,Path with directional change,Path then hovering
content.summary: Mothership and smaller lights over denver

content.detailedDescription:
I was out walking on my road.  when i got to the end of the road, i turned to begin walking back.  the trek to the end and back is almost a mile.  as i started back, i looked up at the sky.  i live in a fairly active fly zone being near a military base that is about a twenty minute drive way traffic is light and a major airport about another ten minutes from the base.

many stars were out and some were brighter than others.  i then noticed something in the sky moving towards the general s.W direction.  it was moving faster and higher than a jet normally would travel.  i looked for something to scale it to in the sky and once finding something i held it up and counted off five secs.  the object had roughly traveled an inch with those counted seconds.  i stood and watched it for about three minutes or so till it was too far to detect it among the stars.  i then made a mental note to be sure to log on when getting home to report sighting.

thinking about it, i've asked myself that if it were some sort of aircraft from either the international airport or the military base, the craft wouldn't be flying at such the altitude it was due to the relative closeness of either location from where i spotted it.  don't know what it was so in own view, it was a ufo.
content.summary: Out walking and gazed up at the star filled sky.  doing so, noticed a moving object coming from the ne heading sw.

content.detailedDescription:
While driving south on route 25 (from trumbull to bridgeport) at 5:25am i noticed a larger than normal star through the trees to the left of the highway. as i passed the trees, the light was very bright as when an airplane is approaching you in an angle where you can see its headlights. however, the light remained stationary and no sound came from it ( i lowered my car window to try to hear anything).

to verify if the object was moving i decreased my car speed to about 25mph and it still appeared stationary. the object appeared too close and too big to be star. at least every other star i ever saw.

when i reached my destination, i got out of the car and the object was still there, stationary. the light was solid and did not blink as stars do.

after finishing the task at hand which lasted maybe 15 minutes i drove  back home but was not able to locate the object in the sky any longer. all other stars that i recall where in the same reference position.
content.summary: Very large star like object with bright white color

content.detailedDescription: Laying outside in our back yard in central illinois, a slight breeze out of the west as usual, with clear blue skies about 9 am early sept, nice cool morning.  i was looking up at the sky with my newborn son, pointing stuff out to him, (ex. that is a lady bug, that is a leaf, that is a stick, that is a plane, that is a bird, that ... is a ufo.) thats when i saw something bright orange, and about half as high as the jets that fly over are.  it was huge, cut a city block in half and that is close to the size of it.  it was double cresent shaped, one crescent being larger and more cup shaped, the smaller end had multiple protrusions and jagged looking, alot like a "ferengi ship" in its general shape, though it was spinning horizontally about a central axis. i thought right off the bat, that it was something special and rare.  i grabbed up my baby and quick ran and got my video camera. when we got back out side it wasn't where it should have been for its speed, i thought i had lost it, then i spotted it.  it had moved well to the northwest, and climbed very very high.  i got it in the camera and zoomed in as best i could, and trying to hold it still to keep it in focus.  as i was viewing it later on a bigger screen, there is a small orb that zips past the craft in the opposite direction.  the large craft going to the northwest, and the orb going east-northeast.  i lost sight of the craft when i couldn't keep the zoom out as far as i had it, and keep my hands from shaking it out of the frame.  about an hour later i also zoomed in on a commercial jet to get a size comparison.
content.summary: Bright orange double crescent spinning about a central axis many many times larger than a commercial jet

content.detailedDescription:
Driving southeast just outside of sedalia, on a country road, i saw what looked like an orange light flashing in the sky.  as we went further down the road, i realized that there were really two lights, one stacked on top of the other vertically.  one was always brighter than the other, and when one got brighter, the other dimmed.  this happened again and again, but not flashing, more like pulsing, the lights never quite disappearing.  

i told my husband to pull over so we could have a better look.  about a minute later, i couldn't find it in the sky, and realized it had jumped quite a distance from the west to the east, but i never saw it move.  about three or four minutes later, it was back to where it originally started from.  it then suddenly seemed to turn and disappear south.
content.summary: Two orange lights in the sky, seemingly connected vertically, pulsing in and out.

content.detailedDescription: I was driving east toward work when i saw 2 silver slivers (like along the side of a pie plate) in the sky ahead. i thought they could be planes at first, it looked like they were shining because of the sunrise. i was stopped at a light (the longest light in town) just watching these things hover and glint in the light. they didn't move at all. they were at least a few miles east of me, and they hovered. then, a third one appeared to the north of the other 2. i pulled into the office parking lot and got out of my car. they were still there and i watched them for another minute or 2 and went inside. i didn't say anything to anyone about it. it was just cool to see.
content.summary: 3 silver discs/slivers in the sky at sunrise, stationary position for at least 5 minutes

content.detailedDescription: This picture shows a small white object on the right side, but when you enlarge the picture, you can see several greenish spheres.
content.summary: Small white object appearing to be followed by greenish spheres

content.detailedDescription:
I don't know what this is, but this picture was taken close to salt lake city airport.

i don't want to say to much other than the objects seem to be very close together.  perhaps someone with good analysis programs can tell if they are really close, or just appear to be.  there are also other objects in the picture.

can someone analyze this?

thanks.  peace.

jim
content.summary: Photograph of planes or other objects in close vicinity, above and below

content.detailedDescription:
Sighting on september 6th 2007 dexter mi

i was coming home from work at 1:00am traveling east on i-94 toward ann arbor when i noticed off to my left a group of several quite rapidly strobing red lights. these were perhaps at 2000 feet and moving very slowly. 

i turned onto 14 heading north and again observed the cluster of strobing red lights, and as i did so i saw a smaller, bright white light separate from the group of red lights and travel at high speed in the opposite direction of it���s course, back toward ann arbor. it was quickly lost to my sight, so i looked back at the cluster of red lights while trying to stay on the road. 

i should have just pulled over and got out to watch, but this was an unusual thing to see, and i was so absorbed in it that i didn���t think of that at the time. as i watched the group of red strobing lights moved slowly in seeming increments along i-94 in a westerly direction and about a mile north of the freeway.

as i continued on 14 i lost sight of it. i considered the smaller bright white light that had come out of it and the speed at which it had left, it���s lack of any navigation lights, and thought that perhaps the two observed objects were not ours.

of the cluster of rapidly strobing red lights i observed that it in no way complied with our standard aircraft lighting conventions, there were only red lights, and the rapid strobing also is not something one of ours would do, and the acceleration of the small bright white lighted object was quite beyond anything we can do with a manned aircraft, so all of this was pretty non-conventional.

things like this keep life interesting. i���m glad to have seen it.
content.flightPath: Hovering then path,Path with directional change,Path then hovering
content.summary: Sighting near ann arbor

content.detailedDescription:
Brilliant-silver-triangle(like paper airplane)-like sparks coming out of b

ack(not to many).     



 on highway 64 about 4 miles east of new richmond, wi both my wife and i saw it at the same time.  it was to our left coming down at a 30% angle.   it was brilliant silver with a diangled line on its side. some silver particles were emitted from its tail(not to many). estimated 1 1/2 miles away and the size of minny bus. we saw it for about 5 seconds an it  plunged into a woods.  no road to it.  neither of use could identify it,
content.summary: Moving in car @ it appeared to the left-30% angle into a woods

content.detailedDescription: I didnt include my info because i want to remain. anonymous. i just thought you would like to know i saw something.  i was driving down dodge st. (76th and dodge) above was a hovering triangle. 3 white lights one corners with one slow pulsating red light in the middle. hovering low.  thought it was a helicopter....It wasnt.  drove past and looked in my rear view mirror and it was gone.  ive seen this damn thing twice now thats the only reason im typing something on this site.  the first time was over the woodman building in downtown omaha a few months ago. (4a.M  that time it flew over along with another white light that wasnt connected. just following it. pretty amazing..But scared the hell out of me.   enjoy.  i know many have reporting this same thing through looking it up on the net.  so whatever that triangle is, ive seen it.
content.summary: Driving down dodge st. (76th and dodge) above was a hovering triangle. 3 white lights one corners with one slow pulsating red light in the middle.

content.detailedDescription: Concrete proof that every photo, film or video taken of ufo's in the last 100 years has recorded an object made by man -- and how they were made -- www.Ufohowto.Com
content.shape: Blimp,  Bullet,  Missile,  Cigar,  Chevron,  Circle,  Cylinder,  Disc,  Egg,  Oval,  Sphere,  Teardrop,  Triangle
content.summary: Proof that all ufo recordings for the last 100 years show man-made objects

content.detailedDescription:
I was coming over the bridge from exit 20 off of rt. i-90w and was at the stop light intersecting rt. 2, when i looked up into the blue sky (almost no clouds in the air and great visibility) and i saw something odd.  at quick glance the object seemed to be one of those white banners that planes will trail behind them for advertising, but when i looked back i realized the banner was too far away to read and that there was no plane in front of it.  this is when i decided to really look at it to figure out what the heck it was.  it was not a plane as there was no tail, and if the nose was facing me then the wings would taper off, and there was no taper on the ends.  it also was not rounded like a blimp or baloon so those were ruled out and it was far too long to be a helicopter.  this object was white and rectangular and had two greyish/offwhite stripes evenly separated in the middle of the object.

after a few moments i saw the object begin to become almost transparent as it stayed near motionless.  this part of the experience is hard to describe, but the object seemed to flicker a bit (by flicker, i mean it was visible one second, invisible the next, then back to visible, then back to invisible, etc.), this process lasted at most 5 seconds before the object was gone.  i had a broad view of the sky and spent the next 10 seconds or so scanning the sky to try to find where the object had gone.  i could not find any trace of it and then my light turned green.

i was working at the time and going to an office to deliver equipment and a co-worker was in the car behind me following me to this location.  (for the record this person adamantly does not believe in ufo's.)  once we arrived at the loction a few minutes after the incident, we got out of our cars and shared our thoughts on what we saw.  he said, like i did, that this was definitly not a plane, blimp, balloon, banner, glider, or helicopter.  this was something neither of us have ever seen before.  he looked at it for a while like i did, but he looked away when the object was in the process of "flickering" and when he looked back the object was completely gone from the sky.  like myself, he spent the next 10-20 seconds before the light turned green scouring the sky to find any evidence of this object's presence.  he too was unable to see the object again and was unable to explain the incident.

if anyone else saw this same incident please email me about your experience (mfboomertime@yahoo.Com), i would love to hear either a logical explanation of this event or someone else who could corroborate my experience.
content.summary: Rectangular object hovering in air then became transparent and disappeared

content.detailedDescription: I was in harbor at a friends house. it wasd around 2am the sky was clear and the stars looked distant. i looked directly above twards the sky and noticed what i first thought was a bird. i noticed that what i thought were its wings were still in place. i had my friend look and we both agreed that it was too high to be a bird unless it was a big big bird. as dark as it was and as high as it was we could see it some what clearly. i then came to the conclusion that it must be a plane beacuse what we thought were wings were stuck in place. what we thought was flapping wings turned out to be 3 to 4 airplane like wings extending outwards  about 2 thirds the size of the object. we b oth decided it could not have been a plane beacuse it didnt have the little red light and it seemed to be tumbling in a 360 degree circular motion. like ball hoovering in place that spun randomly in all angles. it was not bright but it was sort of florecent white but very dim. mabey so that it could not be seen. my friend and i both were curious and stumped. it was not a satelite, gravity gave that one up. it was not a bird or a plane. we have a small airport and i see planes verry often and this was noticably larger and traveled much faster for how high it was. we watched as it crossed the sky. at the altitude it was it traveled in both our opinions at a steady fast rate. i first saw it south of us heading north. after flying over the top of us continuing north it seemed to increase in altitude, slowing down but not much as it fadded. we would have maintined a good visual if it maintained altitude as it headded north but beacuse it increased in altitude it faded much sooner than it would have. my friend mentioned this website emediatly after loosing site. we both agreed on what we saw but couldnt come to any reasonable conclusion. my friend as well as i will tell u that what we saw was not a plane, bird, baloon, or satelite. i can say that i have not seen anything resembling it from ufo pics on tv or any popular pics. what we saw was truely unexplainable and i cant compare it to anything ive ever seen.
content.summary: A cross from a white star/bird tumbled across sky almost rolled

content.detailedDescription:
Reconstructed as this image.  i had no camera present.

http://www.Abidemiracles.Com/images/65contact/071004dartingufo.Jpg

standing on the balcony. i had gone out to see whether the chemtrail clouds had cleared; and what is this?

a black boomerang shaped bat-like thing, as large as the airplane, darting around this 737 that was on takeoff from san jose airport.

i wonder what the passengers saw.

: )  chai
content.summary: Darting ufo -- toying with a 737 over san jose
